item.title: I dont understand how to make nonwild zones
item.dc:creator: @VorargC VorargC
item.description:
@VorargC wrote:

public boolean nonWild() { if((absX >= 3249 && absX <= 3258 && absY >= 3438 && absY <=3431 ) || (absX >= 3249 && absX <= 3260 && absY >=3435 && absY <=3437 ) || (absX >= 3249 && absX <= 3253 && absY >=3431 && absY <=3437 ) || (absX >=3250 && absX <=3257 && absY >=3419 && absY <=3423 ) ||(absX >=3250 && absX <=3257 && absY >=3419 && absY <=3423 )||(absX >=3156 && absX <=3277 && absY >=3374 && absY <=3514 )||(absX >=2668 && absX <=2684 && absY >=3413 && absY <=3428 )||(absX >=2577 && absX <=2596 && absY >=3903 && absY <=3921 )||(absX >= 2319 && absX <= 2355 && absY >= 3157 && absY <=3188 ) || heightLevel == 1) return true; else return false; }

Theres what i have, Its full varrock safezone.

Read full topic

item.title: I dont understand how to make nonwild zones
item.dc:creator: @gunztheduel gunztheduel
item.description:
@gunztheduel wrote:

public boolean nonWild() { if((absX >= 3249 && absX <= 3258 && absY >= 3438 && absY <=3431 ) || heightLevel == 1) return true; else return false; }

“if((absX >= 3249 && absX <= 3258 && absY >= 3438 && absY <=3431 ) ||”.
Why is it absx >=coords && absx >=coords && absY >=coords && absY >=coords?

Shouldn’t it be absX, then absY, then absX, then absY for the ranges?

Read full topic
item.source: I dont understand how to make nonwild zones
